reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening Health Systems capacity to provide equitable, effective and efficient package of comprehensive and quality health services to Ethiopians

description.narrative: Ethiopia - RSSH - Federal Ministry of Health of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia - FMOH. This program has the following goals: Ensure everyone who needs health services (promotion, prevention, curative, rehabilitative and palliative services) is able to get them without undue hardship.. The objectives of this program are: Improve development and management of human resources for health: Improve human resources planning, development and management. The focus is on recruitment as per the need, deployment of staff, performance management and motivation.. Improve regulatory systems: Improve the regulatory system through implementation of an effective, transparent and accountable system that ensures adherence by all state and non-state actors to the standards set by the country’s rules and regulations.. Improve supply chain and logistics management: Ensure access to quality assured, safe, effective and affordable essential medicines with which the sector intends to respond to the majority of health problems of the society; significant reduction in pharmaceutical wastage and improved rational drug use.. Improve research and evidence for decision-making: Improve decision making through evidence generation, translation and dissemination. Promote and advocate the culture of generating quality data, ensuring transmission and acquisition of complete and timely data, verification, analysis and synthesis of data from multiple sources and using evidence at all levels to improve quality and equity of health services.. Enhance use of technology and innovation: Enhance use of the existing technology, introduction of new technology, technology transfer and development and use of local technology.. Improve efficiency and effectiveness: Proper allocation, efficient utilization, tracking and controlling of resources. It also entails harmonization and alignment among stakeholders to strengthen the financial and procurement management system of the government, to minimize wastage of resources and duplication of efforts.

title.narrative: Outcome indicator for ETH-S-FMOH
RSSH O-other 1: UHC service coverage index
RSSH O-Other 2: Percentage of births attended by skilled health professional
Percentage of women attending antenatal care
Ratio of household out-of-pocket payments for health to total expenditure on health

DOTS-3: Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period
M&E-1: Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people and/or sprayed by IRS within the last 12 months
Percentage of births attended by skilled health professional

DOTS-2a: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all new TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period
HSS-Other 1: Availability of tracer drugs in health facilities (Based on list of tracer drugs identified by MOH and included in HMIS and Reports generated by HMIS)
Coverage / Output indicator for ETH-S-FMOH
HSS-other 1: Number of health agencies/RHBs under FMOH implementing IFMIS
M&E-other 4: Proportion of Health Posts implementing Community Health Information System
CM-other 1: Proportion of Health Posts implementing iCCM
DOTS-other 1: Proportion of laboratories performing regular integrated external quality assurance for TB smear microscopy
M&E-other 1: Proportion of health facilities performing data quality audits using LQAS methodology during the reporting period
M&E-other 3: Proportion of health facilities with verification factor within 15% for TB cases notified
Lab-Other 1:Percentage of labs participating in TB EQA scheme among all public health facilites offering TB lab services
PSM-other 2: Number of quality control tests of random samples performed by EFMHACA for the Global Fund funded health products
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
PSM-Other 1: Percentage of essential medicines and life-saving commodities in stock at health facilities
Percentage of consignments delivered on-time and in-full among the total number of consignments expected to be delivered for the three diseases during the reporting period
Number of graduates from health workforce training institutions during the last academic year per 1000 population
M&E-other 2: Proportion of health facilities with verification factor within 15% for number of people on ART
Percentage of service delivery reports from community health workers integrated into HMIS
HW-other 1: Proportion of Health Extension workers who graduated on Career development training program
FMS-Other 1: Percentage of unliquidated advances over 12 months with RHBs, implementing agencies and procurement agents at end of the reporting period.
Proportion of unliquidated advances over 12 months with RHBs, implementing agencies and procurement agents at end of the reporting period
HSS-other 2: Proportion of unliquidated advances over 6 months with RHBs and implementing agencies or partners at end of the reporting period
Percentage of health facilities providing diagnostic services with tracer items available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
Distribution of health workers
HW-Other 1: Proportion of health facilties with a functional human resources information system
Percentage of health facilities with essential medicines and life-saving commodities in stock
Government expenditure on health as percentage of general government expenditure
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Impact indicator for ETH-S-FMOH
RSSH I - other 1: Maternal mortality ratio, per 100,000 population
RSSH I - other 2:Under 5 mortality rate per 1000 live births
Percentage of young people aged 15–24 who are living with HIV
TB prevalence rate per 100,000 population
Neonatal mortality rate, per 100,000 population
Maternal mortality ratio, per 100,000 population
Under 5 mortality rate per 1000 live births
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
